text: Hello again! Is there a way to see a "snapshot" of memory use at any given point in time? It seems to me the `analyze_malloc_data()` way only tells me which line made the most allocations, but not where the "persistent" memory use comes from.

elements.text: Hello again! Is there a way to see a "snapshot" of memory use at any given point in time? It seems to me the
way only tells me which line made the most allocations, but not where the "persistent" memory use comes from.

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>
(my code should be close to constant memory use, but I see the contrary, and I wonder where it's coming from)

elements.text: (my code should be close to constant memory use, but I see the contrary, and I wonder where it's coming from)

text: in general, no. `varinfo` may be helpful in some cases

elements.text: may be helpful in some cases

text: the issue is conceptually, what do you expect to see in such a "snapshot"

elements.text: the issue is conceptually, what do you expect to see in such a "snapshot"

text: some kind of list where each entry would be an object, and the place in the code that generated it

elements.text: some kind of list where each entry would be an object, and the place in the code that generated it

text: Because right now, I have an idea where the unexpected memory use *might* come from, but I've been wrong often enough before to be wary of trying to optimize that before knowing it's really the culprit. I don't know if I'm making sense
